Uttarasthagrahacāra, mūlānakṣatra, toyadevatā, vāyavyamaṇḍala, śuklayoga, śvetamuhūrtta, viṣṭikara

ni hayaṁ, mamantiṅakə:n· hantiga, linaṇḍə:sakə:n·, ri saṁ hyaṁ vatu susuk·, mamaṁmaṁ manapathe, Au;m Indaḥ
ta kita kamu hya;m Aricandanāgāsti mahar̥ṣi, pūrvva dakṣiṇa, paścima, Utara maddhya,moddhāmadaḥ, ravi śaśī
kṣity āpas tejo kāśa dharmmāhorātra sandhyātraya, yakṣasa piśāca, pretāsura garuḍa gandha
rvva kirannara mahorabha yama baruṇa kuvera bhāśava, putra devatā, kuśika gargga metri kuruṣya pā

van ahayu, kita tumonaṅ adoh apaR̥k· riṁ rahineṅ kuL̥m·, kita manarira, Umasuki sarvvabhūta,
At· R̥ṅyə:kə:n tekiṁ śapatha samaya, pamaṁmaṁ mami ri kita kamu hyaṁ kabeḥ, Ikaṁ śapatha sāmaya su
mpaḥ sinrahakə:n iṅ hulun iri kita, yăvat ikaṁ vvaṁ kabeḥ Agə:ṅ aḍmit· salviranya, yadyan· caturaśrama

na deni saṁ hyaṁ Agnī, vehə:n· basmĭbhūta saha dravyanya tan panoliha ri vuntat·, taruṁ riṁ paṅadə:gan·

nya, və:tvakə:n· daL̥manya, Inum· rāḥnya, Atə:hə:r pə:pə:dakə:n· bvaṅakə:n· vkas i prāṇāntika, bva
ṅakə:n· ri mahārorava, Astu Astu, @ || @, yăvat pratiṣṭate bhūmo, mahāmeru suparvvataḥ, tăva
t kilviṣabhūktiḥ syāt·, rājānugrahalaṅghyanāt·, @, yo rājānugrahaṁ hatvā, mohād mŭrko na-

app.rdg: Aśevana mitā ri bhūpāla maṇi makuṭa ghr̥sita śrī pāda sidha
saptasvarṇa vasundharā dinātha siraḥ kamalamatta dhāraṇa

app.note: Cf. PW, 583 and numerous Cambodian inscriptions; nothing in . But the word simply seems to mean ‘intoxicated elephant’ here.

app.rdg: raṇa raṅga madhya, pratihata bhuja balabhīma
jaya śrī viṣṇuvarddhana saha prakira nopama satputra
śrī jayavarddhani devĭ samudramandarā, vala manthāna mahāmr̥ta maya

app.note: It seems we are dealing with a simple case of dittography here, unless one needs to emend kalimunan, cf. 12v1.
One could also read jintur, jinkur, vantur, vankur, vintur, vinkur, none of which is a known word; but jantur is found in 13r5, so we presume the i-vocalization was intentionally rubbed out.
Is the repetition of the same name for two different people a mistake?
